image.altText: Handcuffed prisoner being led in corridor by warden.

props.synopsis: Just 57 Tasmanian children are responsible for half of all youth crime in the state, data shows, with a senior police officer saying the "therapeutic" approach won't work for some kids.

title.children: 57 kids 'responsible' for half of youth crime across Tasmania, data shows

image.altText: Indoor salmon farming facility with a series of tanks.

props.synopsis: In Canada, the government has committed to transition marine salmon farming near British Columbia to onshore operations by 2029. Tasmanian Greens want the state government to follow suit, but the salmon industry says it's a case of "voodoo economics".

title.children: The Greens say land-based salmon farming is viable. The Tasmanian industry says otherwise

image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: Some Tasmanians are considering voting for non-major party candidates for the first time at Saturday's federal election, saying they are increasingly dissatisfied with the policies of Labor and the Liberals.

title.children: Too 'negative' and wrong priorities: Labor, Liberals on the nose with these voters

image.altText: Cans and bottles sit in a cage awaiting the recycling process.

props.synopsis: Day one of Tasmania's long-awaited container refund scheme has kicked off. Eligible cans or bottles can now be deposited at one of 40 collection sites across the state for a refund price of 10 cents per container. And so far, the uptake has been "remarkable".

title.children: Tasmania's container refund scheme has started. Here's what to know

image.altText: Aerial view of southern right whale cow-calf pairs.

props.synopsis: The southern right whale species had the unfortunate habit of going close to shore, making them easy pickings for whalers. After the practice was banned, their population bounced back — but researchers say something disturbing is happening to their numbers.

title.children: Something is happening with the southern right whale population, scientists say

image.altText: The two men standing shoulder to shoulder, Pope Francis does not look amused

props.synopsis: The conclave will be a "fight for the soul of the Catholic Church" between those who saw promise in the modernising changes Pope Francis made and those "who hated him for it".

title.children: The secret MAGA battle for dominance in the Catholic church

image.altText: Side profile of a middle-aged white woman with long brown hair standing in a dark-lit situation room near abstract screens.

props.synopsis: Scientists and legal experts warn against commercial deep-sea mining as US President Donald Trump signs an executive order opening up both US and international waters.

title.children: Trump moves world a step closer to commercial deep-sea mining

image.altText: People walk on a pier in front of Singapore's merlion statue and the city's skyline

props.synopsis: It calls itself a democracy, yet the wealthy city-state has had the same ruling party since 1959. That is unlikely to change anytime soon.

title.children: Singapore's election is also on Saturday — but we already know the outcome

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: The post linked to state-run media said that the US had reached out through multiple channels hoping to discuss its tariff policy with Beijing.

title.children: A Chinese state media post points to a softening in the US-China trade war

image.altText: two women

props.synopsis: RecipeTin Eats founder Nagi Maehashi calls for an end to the "trolling" of baking sensation Brooke Bellamy, after accusing her of plagiarism.

title.children: RecipeTin Eats founder pleads with fans to 'stop trolling' Brooke Bellamy

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's estranged husband tells a court he thought she loved his family in the lead-up to their deaths from eating a poisonous beef Wellington she had cooked.

title.children: Simon Patterson tells court of 'strained' relationship with alleged mushroom killer

image.altText: planet ark kids

props.synopsis: Planet Ark Environmental Foundation, one of Australia's largest environmental non-for-profits, has entered voluntary administration following a review of its "financial position and future viability".

title.children: Environmental not-for-profit Planet Ark goes into voluntary administration

image.altText: A headshot of Diddy wearing a white suit, standing in front of a grey background

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs tells a US federal court hearing he rejected prosecutors' offer for a plea deal ahead of facing trial over racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking charges.

title.children: 'Diddy' rejects plea deal ahead of sex trafficking trial

image.altText: Handcuffed prisoner being led in corridor by warden.

props.synopsis: Just 57 Tasmanian children are responsible for half of all youth crime in the state, data shows, with a senior police officer saying the "therapeutic" approach won't work for some kids.

title.children: 57 kids 'responsible' for half of youth crime across Tasmania, data shows

image.altText: A missile the size of several cars is towed on the back of a truck down a street lined with onlookers

props.synopsis: Experts say a military conflict between the nuclear neighbours is almost guaranteed. When nukes are involved, escalation is a possibility the world takes seriously. What are the odds of it going that far?

title.children: With India and Pakistan on a collision course, what's the risk of nuclear war?

image.altText: Queensland and NSW players Julia Robinson and Jaime Chapman contest for the ball in the air during State of Origin.

props.synopsis: Eye gouges, hair pulls, a classic duel and a glorious night for the new kids on the block. Here are five quick hits from the Women's State of Origin series opener.

title.children: Five quick hits: A classic duel and a hair pull in Origin opener

image.altText: CCTV of a man running with a knife in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: The footage shows the moment NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott reached for her gun in its holster as Joel Cauchi ran towards her while brandishing a knife.

title.children: Moment before officer shoots Bondi Junction stabber shown in new CCTV

image.altText: Alastair Clarkson looks over his shoulder during the Kangaroos vs Bombers match.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne coach Alastair Clarkson questions the AFL's decision to suspend Paul Curtis for three matches after the Kangaroos record a sixth straight defeat.

title.children: Clarkson hits out at AFL over Curtis ban after Roos' loss to Bombers

image.altText: Steven Mao and Jessica Yuan anding out how-to-vote cards wearing Monique Ryan shirts.

props.synopsis: The head of a Chinese community group that helped organise volunteers for two candidates has furiously denied he is trying to help China's government influence the federal election.

title.children: Chinese group denies links to Beijing after roping in election volunteers

image.altText: An elderly woman

props.synopsis: Ethel Caterham says her secret to long life is "never arguing with anyone".

title.children: British great-grandma named world's oldest person after Brazilian nun dies

image.altText: Aerial view of southern right whale cow-calf pairs.

props.synopsis: The southern right whale species had the unfortunate habit of going close to shore, making them easy pickings for whalers. After the practice was banned, their population bounced back — but researchers say something disturbing is happening to their numbers.

title.children: Something is happening with the southern right whale population, scientists say

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: The Coalition has revealed its costings and Labor is feeling optimistic about key seats in Melbourne as election night edges closer.

title.children: Dutton speaks of 'sliding doors moment', Albanese says he's 'nervous'

image.altText: Kamala Harris delivers a speech standing in front of a white backdrop that says emerge

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris in her first major speech since losing the US election in November said President Donald Trump was "counting on the notion that fear can be contagious."

title.children: Trump has created 'greatest economic crisis' in recent history, says Harris

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor press conference

props.synopsis: The budget bottom line would be worse in the first two years of a Dutton Coalition government than under Labor, the party's costings have revealed.

title.children: Coalition costings reveal worse budget for first two years under Dutton compared to Labor

image.altText: Two Victoria Police vehicles on the road.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after antisemitic flyers authorised by neo-Nazis were distributed to Jewish households in Melbourne.

title.children: Neo-Nazi flyers delivered to Jewish households in Melbourne

image.altText: A person holding a violin

props.synopsis: Seeking to learn the origins of a violin built by a mastercraftsman with cheap materials, a repairman opens up the instrument to discover a note left by its creator imprisoned in Dachau concentration camp.

title.children: Note found in violin constructed in Nazi concentration camp

image.altText: Lines of blue and white police tape cross a busy city street where a police car is parked and officers stand.

props.synopsis: Homicide Squad detectives have charged two more people following a fatal stabbing in a busy nightclub strip in Melbourne's inner south-east.

title.children: Two more men charged over fatal Melbourne stabbing on Easter Sunday

image.altText: Colourful painting of man on horse with moutains in background and coloured butterflies overhead.

props.synopsis: Abdul Abdullah has won the $3,000 Packing Room Prize at this year's Archibald Prize for his portrait of Jason Phu.

title.children: Painting of a 'reluctant hero' takes gong in portrait prize

image.altText: Greens candidate Mandy Nolan and nurses

props.synopsis: Tensions are high in the NSW seat of Richmond, where nurses desperate for better pay say they are under pressure from their former allies for handing out Greens flyers.

title.children: Fed-up nurses campaigning for Greens allege pre-poll bullying by Labor

image.altText: a woman holds a vape as she blows smoke out of her mouth while walking outdoors

props.synopsis: The Coalition has confirmed it would tax vapes and allow them to be sold at retail stores, raising billions for the budget.

title.children: Vaping rules to be eased under Coalition government

image.altText: Zempilas and Papalia

props.synopsis: WA Opposition leader Basil Zempilas says the state government has misled the public over the use of GPS trackers for serious repeat domestic violence offenders after a letter suggested there were warnings against their use outside of Perth.

title.children: Minister accused of misleading public over tracking WA domestic violence offenders

image.altText: A woman with dyed hair and a man with a neck tattoo huddle together for a selfie.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will spend five months in jail for making fake $50 and $100 notes after deciding that it was an "easy" way to make money.

title.children: Jail for couple inspired to counterfeit cash after watching TikTok video

image.altText: Becky Lucas, a woman in her 30s, stands smiling on stage, holding a microphone in her hand, and wearing a floral blouse.

props.synopsis: Becky Lucas, Luke McGregor and Jen Carnovale are comedians returning with their first shows since becoming parents. How has parenthood shaped them and their jokes?

title.children: 'That part of me went away': Finding the funny again after having kids
